00020 #include "HomogeneousMatrix44.h"
00021 
00022 namespace brics_3d {

00024 HomogeneousMatrix44::~HomogeneousMatrix44() {
00025 
00026 }
00027 
00028 
00029 HomogeneousMatrix44::HomogeneousMatrix44(double r0, double r1, double r2, double r3, double r4, double r5, double r6, double r7, double r8, double t0, double t1, double t2) {
00030         /*
00031          * column-row layout:
00032          * 0 4 8  12
00033          * 1 5 9  13
00034          * 2 6 10 14
00035          * 3 7 11 15
00036          */
00037         /* rotation */
00038         matrixData[0] = r0;
00039         matrixData[4] = r1;
00040         matrixData[8] = r2;
00041         matrixData[1] = r3;
00042         matrixData[5] = r4;
00043         matrixData[9] = r5;
00044         matrixData[2] = r6;
00045         matrixData[6] = r7;
00046         matrixData[10] = r8;
00047 
00048         /* translation */
00049         matrixData[12] = t0;
00050         matrixData[13] = t1;
00051         matrixData[14] = t2;
00052 
00053         //homogeneous coefficients
00054         matrixData[3] = 0.0;
00055         matrixData[7] = 0.0;
00056         matrixData[11] = 0.0;
00057         matrixData[15] = 1.0;
00058 }
00059 
00060 HomogeneousMatrix44::HomogeneousMatrix44(Transform3d *homogeneousTransformation) {
00061         double *tmpMatrix;
00062 
00063         tmpMatrix = homogeneousTransformation->data(); //get data in column-row order
00064         memcpy(&matrixData, tmpMatrix, sizeof(double)*matrixElements);
00065 }
00066 
00067 const double* HomogeneousMatrix44::getRawData() const {
00068         return (double*)&matrixData;
00069 }
00070 
00071 double* HomogeneousMatrix44::setRawData() {
00072         return (double*)&matrixData;
00073 }
00074 
00075 IHomogeneousMatrix44* HomogeneousMatrix44::operator*(const IHomogeneousMatrix44 &matrix) {
00076         const double *tmpMultiplicand = matrix.getRawData();
00077         double multiplicand[matrixElements]; // this wil be interpreted(mapped) as an Eigen matrix, thus we need sth writable...
00078         memcpy(&multiplicand, tmpMultiplicand, sizeof(double)*matrixElements);
00079 
00080         Eigen::Map<Eigen::Matrix4d> tempMatrix1(matrixData); //layout for BRICS and Eigen2 4x4 matrices is the same ;-)
00081         Eigen::Map<Eigen::Matrix4d> tempMatrix2(multiplicand);
00082         Eigen::Matrix4d result;
00083 
00084         result = tempMatrix1 * tempMatrix2;
00085 
00086         /* copy back the result */
00087         double *tmpMatrix;
00088         tmpMatrix = result.data(); //get data in column-row order
00089         memcpy(&matrixData, tmpMatrix, sizeof(double)*matrixElements);
00090 
00091         return this;
00092 }
00093 
00094 //IHomogeneousMatrix44* HomogeneousMatrix44::operator*=(const IHomogeneousMatrix44 &matrix1, const IHomogeneousMatrix44 &matrix2) {
00095 //
00096 //}
00097 
00098 IHomogeneousMatrix44* HomogeneousMatrix44::operator=(const IHomogeneousMatrix44 &matrix) {
00099         const double* newMatrixData = matrix.getRawData();
00100         memcpy(&matrixData, newMatrixData, sizeof(double)*matrixElements);
00101 
00102     return this;
00103 }
00104 
00105 bool HomogeneousMatrix44::isIdentity(double precision) {
00106         Eigen::Map<Eigen::Matrix4d> eigenMatrix(matrixData);
00107         return eigenMatrix.isApprox(Eigen::Matrix4d::Identity(), precision);
00108 }
00109 
00110 void HomogeneousMatrix44::inverse() { //could be refactored towards returning a new inverse matrix
00111         Transform3d result;
00112 
00113         Eigen::Map<Eigen::Matrix4d> eigenMatrix(matrixData);
00114         Transform3d transform;
00115         transform.matrix() = eigenMatrix;
00116 
00117 
00118         result = transform.inverse();
00119         double *tmpMatrix;
00120         tmpMatrix = result.data(); //get data in column-row order
00121         memcpy(&matrixData, tmpMatrix, sizeof(double)*matrixElements);
00122 
00123 }
00124 
00125 ostream& operator<<(ostream &outStream, const IHomogeneousMatrix44 &matrix) {
00126         const double *matrixData = matrix.getRawData();
00127 
00128         /* go through 4x4 column-row layout */
00129         for (int row = 0; row < 4; ++row) {
00130                 for (int col = row; col < row+9; col += 4) {
00131                         outStream << matrixData[col] << " ";
00132                 }
00133                 outStream << matrixData[row+12]; // without space at end of row
00134                 outStream << std::endl;
00135         }
00136 
00137         return outStream;
00138 }
